attributes.action: change the age limit on the C2C train service so that even if you are 16 but still in compulsory full time education, you can still buy a child ticket.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I am Susannah Baughan and although I appreciate the rail service C2C provide, I do not agree with the age limit you have on purchasing child tickets. I have recently turned 16 and I am still in full time education, therefore i strongly feel I should only have to purchase a child ticket as my family income has not increased since I have turned 16. I used to pay £4.50 for a daily return as a child, now i have to pay £9.00 as I am classed as an adult. For a weekly ticket I used to pay £21.00, i now have to pay £40.00.
I believe a better alternative to the current scheme would be to issue a card for all pupils still in full time education which entitles them to get a child fare.
